name: Operation Blacksmith: Lazarus
description: Layer showing techniques used by Lazarus in Operation Blacksmith.

techniques.comment: Used commands like 'whoami', 'ver', 'getmac' for system information discovery.
Two DLang-based RATs, NineRAT and DLRAT, used for command and control.
An unauthorized local user account with administrative privileges was created.
Made use of actions that help in lateral movement, such as turning off security mechanisms.
Made use of known exploits for initial access to vulnerable public-facing servers.
Used CVE-2021-44228 for client execution and gaining initial access.
Extracted data from the local system using NineRAT, DLRAT malware.
Credential dumping utilities like MimiKatz were used.
Multiple C2 servers were used for fallback channels.
Exploited publicly facing VMWare Horizon servers using CVE-2021-44228.
Encoded nineRAT payloads were decoded before use.
Base64 encoding used to obfuscate commands from the C2 server.
NineRAT malware used to list the software running on the infected machine.
BottomLoader malware downloaded payloads and sent files to a C2 server.
Two API tokens used by nineRAT malware for interacting with Telegram channels.
DLRAT can delete itself from the system via a batch file.
